citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The following required records were not available at time of inspection: The written program of veterinary care, the
contingency plan, and the plan for environment enhancement to promote the psychological well-being of birds.
These documents should be made available at time of inspection for review.
To be corrected by November 1, 2023

In the alpaca outdoor housing pen: There were two sections of fencing along the bottom fence-line that were in disrepair.
The resulting gaps, one, approximately 12 inches X 6 inches, the second, approximately 14 inches X 2.5 inches in size
were large enough for a foot or a muzzle to get caught and injured. Outdoor housing facilities should be maintained in
good repair to protect the animals from injury.
To be corrected by November 1, 2023

The lid of the pig food storage container is cracked with approximately a quarter of the lid absent. Food stored in this
manner may not be protected and can become readily spoiled and/or contaminated. Supplies of food shall be stored in
facilities which adequately protect such supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin.
To be corrected by October 17,2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
BONNIE BOONE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The following required records were not available at time of inspection: The written program of veterinary care, the 
contingency plan, and the plan for environment enhancement to promote the psychological well-being of birds. 
These documents should be made available at time of inspection for review.  
To be corrected by November 1, 2023 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
In the alpaca outdoor housing pen: There were two sections of fencing along the bottom fence-line that were in disrepair. 
The resulting gaps, one, approximately 12 inches X 6 inches, the second, approximately 14 inches X 2.5 inches in size 
were large enough for a foot or a muzzle to get caught and injured. Outdoor housing facilities should be maintained in 
good repair to protect the animals from injury. 
To be corrected by November 1, 2023 
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The lid of the pig food storage container is cracked with approximately a quarter of the lid absent. Food stored in this 
manner may not be protected and can become readily spoiled and/or contaminated. Supplies of food shall be stored in 
facilities which adequately protect such supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin.  
To be corrected by October 17,2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
BONNIE BOONE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
